snippet: The Affordable Care Act’s open enrollment period for health insurance expired on April 30, but people with special circumstances can still get coverage.
abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser notes that deadline for open enrollment for health insurance under Affordable Care Act has passed, but advises that there are exceptions for those who have changes in circumstances.
lead_paragraph: The Affordable Care Act’s open enrollment period for health insurance expired on April 30, but people with special circumstances can still get coverage.

headline.print_headline: Health Insurance Deadline Passes for Most, but There Are Exceptions
headline.main: Health Insurance Deadline Passes for Most, but There Are Exceptions

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
